casename: Jeyaretnam Joshua Benjamin v Lee Kuan Yew
coram: Chao Hick Tin JA; L P Thean JA
counsel: Appellant in person; Davinder Singh SC and Hri Kumar (Drew & Napier LLC) for the respondent
tags-parsed: Civil Procedure/Striking out/Dismissal of action for want of prosecution/Principles applicable/Inordinate and inexcusable delay/Respondent's delay of over two years without reason or explanation/Whether delay amounts to intentional and contumelious default/Prejudice by reason of delay/Whether unavailability of services of particular Queen's Counsel amounts to prejudice/Whether inordinate and inexcusable delay amounts to abuse of court process/Limitation period yet to expire/Whether action should be struck out

Statutory Interpretation/Statutes/Repealing/Repeal of Rules of Court O 3 r 5/Effect of repeal/Distinction between substantive and procedural rights/Whether amendments to procedural rules affect rights of parties retrospectively/Whether rights under repealed order survive/s 16(1)(c) Interpretation Act (Cap 1, 1999 Ed)
